docs.snippet: President Juan D. Peron's persoral, secretary, Jose Lopez Rega- has created a political controversy here by suggesting that the presence of Jews in the Argentine Government has put the country at a disadvantage in negotiations with Arab nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan D. Peron's persoral, secretary, Jose Lopez Rega- has created a political controversy here by suggesting that the presence of Jews in the Argentine Government has put the country at a disadvantage in negotiations with Arab nations.
docs.abstract: Argentine Pres Juan D Peron's personal sec Jose Lopez Rega, who recently returned from scaling oil supply pact with Libya, has sparked controversy by suggesting presence of Jews in Argentina have hindered talks with Arabs; Libyan deal for 3-million ton yrly may be raised for 5-million tons to cover exports to Uruguay and Paraguay (S)

headline.main: PERON AIDE STIRS DISPUTE ON JEWS; Hints Make-Up of Cabinet Impeded Talks With Arabs Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: In planning a trip abroad, certain basic preparations are necessary, such as obtaining a passport. While some Caribbean islands and Western Hemisphere countries do not require passports of United States citizens, most other countries do, and a...
docs.lead_paragraph: In planning a trip abroad, certain basic preparations are necessary, such as obtaining a passport. While some Caribbean islands and Western Hemisphere countries do not require passports of United States citizens, most other countries do, and a passport remains the best identification a traveler can have. docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO--"What we really want is to be treated as equals," a Brazilian Army officer told a United States reporter a few days ago, trying to hide years of accumulated resentment. He might well have been speaking for the 24 Latin-American...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO--"What we really want is to be treated as equals," a Brazilian Army officer told a United States reporter a few days ago, trying to hide years of accumulated resentment. He might well have been speaking for the 24 Latin-American Foreign Ministers' who met with Secretary of State Kissinger in Mexico City.
docs.abstract: normalization of relations with Cuba seen as 1 of many issues facing Kissinger in his talks with Latin-Amer foreign mins (S)

docs.snippet: Buried in the inside page on crime and sex in Uruguay's leading newspaper, El Pals, 12 days ago was an article headlined "Pornographic Publication: Five Detained."
docs.lead_paragraph: Buried in the inside page on crime and sex in Uruguay's leading newspaper, El Pals, 12 days ago was an article headlined "Pornographic Publication: Five Detained."
docs.abstract: Juan Carlos Onetti, considered Uruguay's best writer and ranked by many among 3 or 4 leading novelists in Latin Amer, is jailed on charge of having particpated in literary jury that awarded 1st prize to short story subsequently declared obscene and subversive by Uruguay's Govt; arrest seen as part of virulently antileftist campaign against academic and literary community in country long noted for intellectual freedom; strict press censorhsip remains in effect; others arrested are Winston Nelson Marra (who wrote story The Bodyguard, based on killing of police inspector by Uruguayan Tupamaro guerrillas about 4 yrs ago), Mercedes Rein, Hugo Alfaro and Carlos Quijano; police issue warrant for arrest of literary critic Jorge Rufinelli (M)

headline.main: A Leading Writer Is Held in Uruguay

docs.snippet: President Nixon in a televised news conference at the White House said he had sought to avoid confrontation with Moscow over the expulsion of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn from the Soviet Union in order to further detente with the Russians. He said: "If...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Nixon in a televised news conference at the White House said he had sought to avoid confrontation with Moscow over the expulsion of Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn from the Soviet Union in order to further detente with the Russians. He said: "If I thought that breaking relations with the Soviet Union . . . would help him or help thousands of others like him in the Soviet Union, we might do that." [1:5.]

docs.snippet: Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay could reach an agreement to act as a bloc of beef-exporting countries to obtain a relaxation of the tariff barriers imposed by the European Economic Community, sources close to the Uruguayan Foreign Ministry said...
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay could reach an agreement to act as a bloc of beef-exporting countries to obtain a relaxation of the tariff barriers imposed by the European Economic Community, sources close to the Uruguayan Foreign Ministry said today.
docs.abstract: Uruguyan Foreign Min sources rept that Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay could reach agreement to act as beef-exporting bloc to obtain relaxation of tariff barriers imposed by EEC at request of Italy and France; 3 countries issue strong complaint against EEC for raisng import charges on beef from '3d countries'; higher tariffs were also adopted by Belgium and Luxembourg (S)

docs.snippet: The Government of President Juan Maria Bordaberry today shut the left-wing weekly magazine Marcha for 10 editions for publishing a short story frowned on by the authorities.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Government of President Juan Maria Bordaberry today shut the left-wing weekly magazine Marcha for 10 editions for publishing a short story frowned on by the authorities.
docs.abstract: Uruguay Govt on March 5 closes left-wing wkly magazine Marcha for 10 editions for publishing short story by Nelson Marra entitled The Bodyguard, which was frowned upon by authorities; arrests Marra, magazine's editor Carlos Quijano, story editor Hugo Alfaro, and 2 members of jury that had awarded prize to story, Juan Carlos Onetti and Mercedes Reins

headline.main: Uruguay Shuts a Magazine Over Story Regime Opposed
